--0-627216716-1070391013=:3741 Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii Do the photon map routines work inside of rtrace, or are they strictly for the renderers? If they work on a ray-by-ray (bundle-by-bundle) basis, perhaps a version of mkillum could be developed that uses the photon map routines instead of "Radiance Classic" routines. I presume that mkillum would be much faster with photon mapping since mkillum uses a low resolution sampling of its environment. -Chas --0-627216716-1070391013=:3741 Content-Type: text/html; charset=us-ascii
 
Do the photon map routines work inside of rtrace, or are they strictly for the renderers?  If they work on a ray-by-ray (bundle-by-bundle) basis, perhaps a version of mkillum could be developed that uses the photon map routines instead of "Radiance Classic" routines.  I presume that mkillum would be much faster with photon mapping since mkillum uses a low resolution sampling of its environment.
-Chas
